info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rabun, southeastern Macon, Transylvania, Henderson, southeastern Jackson, southeastern Haywood, southwestern Buncombe, northwestern Greenville, northwestern Pickens and northern Oconee Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 820 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Walhalla, or 5 miles north of Oconee State Park, moving northeast at 80 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Brevard, Arden, Mills River, Fletcher, Flat Rock, Etowah, Mountain Home, Laurel Park and Bent Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
